title: Man who killed friend with one punch screamed 'oh my god I've killed him'
text:

This is the first picture of a man who killed his childhood friend with one punch.

Marcus Parchment, 42, has been jailed for four years after admitting the manslaughter of pal Damien Howl.

He hit Mr Howl on the side of the neck in a brawl outside his home in West Bromwich on June 5.

The victim was hit so hard that he was sent flying backward and severed an artery and suffered a bleed on his brain.

He died at Queen Elizabeth Hospital in Birmingham the same day, Birmingham Live reports .

Wolverhampton Crown Court was told Parchment and Mr Howl had been friends since they were at junior school and often met up.

On the evening of June 4, Mr Howl had gone to the bungalow Parchment shared with his 83-year-old grandmother and they had both drank alcohol and consumed cocaine.

They stayed together until the early hours of the following morning - and it was at 5.05am West Midlands Police received a call from the ambulance service, informing them a male was in cardiac arrest at the back of the property with a reported head injury.

Amjad Malik QC, prosecuting, told the court paramedics arrived and found Parchment kneeling on the floor, giving CPR to Mr Howl, adding: "Mr Howl was unconscious, he had no pulse and he wasn't breathing. There was significant bleeding around the back of his head."

As medics took over, Parchment watched on, before asking if they could find a pulse.

When they said they couldn’t, he said “Oh my God, I’ve killed him”, before he fell to the ground and began rolling around hysterically and crying.

Parchment then went back inside his home, where he was heard saying to his grandmother "I don't know why he wanted to fight with me".

He was still "distressed" when a police officer arrived and his clothing, shoes and left arm were covered in Mr Howl's blood.

The court heard that during a police interview following his arrest, Parchment had been “vague” about what happened and said Mr Howl had suggested they should playfight.

He told officers he was reluctant at first due to his age and bad back, but "somehow" they ended up on a patch of wasteland outside the property.

Parchment originally said he didn’t know how he had connected with Mr Howl, he later admitted a single punch.

Gurdeep Garcha, defending, said Parchment was full of remorse for what he did, adding: "There was no hostility between them and no reason for the violence. They were childhood friends.

"He wanted to express through me how sorry he is for the loss of his friend and the life-changing event he has visited upon Mr Howl's family.

"He understands they are unlikely to ever be able to forgive him and nobody could blame them for that."

As he jailed Parchment, Judge James Burbidge said Mr Howl had been three times over the legal drink drive limit and that had put him in “no position to defend himself”.

The judge added: “You punched him so hard, he was in reality dying at that moment.

“You ended his life but you also devastated many lives.

“Damien Howl was much loved and had much to live for. His loss have affected many lives and will continue to do so."
description: Marcus Parchment, 42, was jailed for four years after admitting the manslaughter of pal Damien Howl in West Bromwich
